thread.title: Matt Le Tissier wins on Countdown: Twitter reacts with shock that a footballer has a brain - TV
thread.title_full: Matt Le Tissier wins on Countdown: Twitter reacts with shock that a footballer has a brain - TV News - Digital Spy

author: Tasha Hegarty
title: Matt Le Tissier wins on Countdown: Twitter reacts with shock that a footballer has a brain - TV
text: Matt Le Tissier was on Countdown today (September 30), and he surprised a lot of people by winning with an impressive 105 points.He was joined by fellow ex-footballer Graeme Le Saux, who was in Dictionary Corner.Here's a selection of some of the online bafflement that accompanied the appearances:So, Matt Le Tissier was a contestant on @C4Countdown today. And Graeme Le Saux was in Dictionary Corner #noreally pic.twitter.com/hRMKczgGze— Paul Jones (@Jonesvision) September 30, 2015 Watching Matt Le Tissier as a contestant on Countdown is like watching Robbie Savage being asked to conduct an orchestra. Really odd.— Joe Taylor (@jpttaylor) September 30, 2015 Wow Matt Le Tissier is a contestant on Countdown today... actual Matt Le Tissier, actual contestant, actual Countdown— Ruth John (@Rumyra) September 30, 2015 Matt Le Tissier is on countdown beating some fat nerd for anyone who's arsed— Mescalèro Moore (@SMooron) September 30, 2015 Turns out Matt Le Tissier is an excellent #Countdown player. He'll probably be on the verge of representing England at it but just miss out— Mark O'Meara (@mark_omeara89) September 30, 2015 Matt Le Tissier is currently hammering some guy on Countdown. And they've got Graeme Le Saux in Dictionary Corner. Where's Jeff Stelling?— Me (@Mon_Jet) September 30, 2015 Rachel Riley..."this must be new to Matt (le tissier) he's not used to winning in Manchester" ha..brilliant!! #countdown— sadie trowbridge (@shadysade) September 30, 2015 Killed the letters and numbers @mattletiss7. Who knew footballers were so smart?!?! #countdown— Gerard Tesoriero (@GerardTesoriero) September 30, 2015 Matt Le Tissier and Graeme Le Saux both on #countdown What are the chances Wayne Rooney and Joey Barton will be on the show soon?LOL— Nick Di Cristofaro (@NickCristofaro) September 30, 2015 Matt Le Tissier is dominating countdown what has the world come to— Hashim Dadah (@eldoodah) September 30, 2015 I've learnt two things today: Matt Le Tissier is a Countdown monsterThere are somehow still ways to make Reading even more embarrassing.— Tim Scales (@tim_ncfc) September 30, 2015 Countdown airs daily on Channel 4, hosted by Nick Hewer with Rachel Riley at the board.Last month saw a new unwanted letter arrangement in the form of 'slutz'.Other inappropriate words giving Countdown viewers the giggles have included 'todgers', 'itchy semi', 'arse' and 'erection' - which has popped up on more than one occasion.
